metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Handwritten letter stating that a draft for $500 gold has been sent a month ago for his son, Sung Sing Kwan. Dr. Kwan asks that Stearns send his son back to China for three months by way of England to witness the coronation of King George with the Chinese Special Mission, and to return by the Siberial Railway. He proposes an alternative to this plan: that his son would travel with H.E. Lien Tun Yen (Minister of Foreign Affairs in Peking) and Mr. Tong Kaison, In the postscript to the letter Dr. Kwan writes that the coronation will be crowded and because of the high cost to do so. If the , he requests that his son return directly, by way of Japan, since it is cheaper.
